page.title: 08COOMBE HILL
page.content: {COOMBE HILL NEAR DUNSMORE Coombe Hill which belongs to the National Trust is the highest point in the Bucks. Chilterns, with splendid views towards Aylesbury Vale, Chequers Court and Oxon. The hill is mainly uncultivated scrubland and deciduous woodland. It is the home of many wild creatures including Badgers, Squirrels, Muntjac Deer and Glis_Glis. The N.T. may with the approval of the Charity Commission, lease its land. Thus Coombe Hill is let to the local farmers for sheep grazing. The residents of Ellesborough have grazing and wood_gathering rights on the hill. The monument on the summit is not N.T. property. It is a memorial to the 148 local soldiers who fell in the Boer War. It is a eminent landmark which has been struck by lightning at least twice. It has been restored in 1985.
